ep:phrases.ep:phrase: You haven't specified a document type!
You need to select a file to be shown first.

ep:phrase.p: The amount of disk space available for new EPrints has dropped below the repository threshold. New disk space will be needed soon.
If you get sick of this message, lower the "diskspace_warn_threshold" in the config file. If you do this then don't forget to put it back after you add more disk space.
The usual way to add disk space is to symlink a directory on a new drive into the repository "documents" directory.
There are no available partitions with enough disk space to create new items. This needs sorting out urgently.
NO NEW ITEMS WILL BE ADDED UNTIL YOU FIX THIS.
To add more capacity, symlink a directory on a new drive into the repository "documents" directory.

ep:phrase.p: The search failed to execute correctly.
The requested output format is not available.

ep:phrases.ep:phrase: A year search must be specified as a single year, e.g. `2000', or a range of years, e.g. `1990-2000', `1990-' or `-2000'
A numerical search must be specified as a single integer number, e.g. `23', or a range of numbers, e.g. `9-21', `17-' or `-93'
A date search must be specified as a single date or a range.
Search field contains no indexable words: "". The system ignores very small or common words.
Enter some text to search for.
Select one or more values from the list. Default is (Any).
Enter a term or terms to search for.

Enter a name or names to search for. Either the family name, or the family name followed by a comma and the first name or initial. Names with spaces may be indictated by surrounding them with double quotes, eg. "van Damme, J".
Select one or more values from the list, and whether you want to search for records with any one or all of those values. Default is (Any).
Select one or more values from the list, and whether you want to search for records with any one or all of those values. Default is (Any).
Enter one or more usernames (space seperated) and whether you want to search for records with any one or all of those values. Default is (Any).
Enter a term or terms to search for.
Enter a term or terms to search for.
Enter some text to search for.
Enter a single year (e.g. 1999), or a range of years, e.g. `1990-2000', `1990-' or -2000'.
Enter a single number (e.g. 93), or a range of numbers, e.g. `17-23', `17-' or -23'.
Select a single record ID number (e.g. 93), or a range of numbers, e.g. `17-23', `17-' or -23'.

Please enter the information about this item. Fields marked with a * are fields that must be filled out before your deposit will be accepted.

ep:phrase.p: Please enter the URL of the item you wish to upload to the repository in the box below.

Occasionally, uploading this way may not produce a totally accurate copy. This is because some assumptions about the structure of the HTML must be made, to stop the software from trying to upload the whole World-Wide Web!
Enter the filename (with full path) of the compressed file in the box below.
Please enter the filename (with full path) of the document file in the box below.
Please enter the filenames (with full paths) of the document files in the boxes below.

When you are satisfied click the Deposit Item Now button at the foot of this page.
Thank you.
Your submission will now be held for editorial review. Provided there are no problems it should appear in the repository within the next few days.

ep:phrase.p: Please enter correct information about yourself for our records. This information will be useful to us and readers of your items. You don't have to supply all this information if you don't want to; you need only fill out those fields marked with a * to start using the repository.
For instructions on how to change your email address, click here.
You may update the users record.

ep:phrases.ep:phrase: There was a problem reading the posted data and updating the database. Please try again later

p.ep:pin: Number of items user has in repository:

ep:phrase.p: Welcome to the registered user area at &archivename;. Please select one of the options below.
Before you use any of the user area functions, you must fill out your user information.
Select this option to see your user record, and to correct or update your user information.

ep:phrases.ep:phrase: Review your items in the repository

ep:phrase.p: This options allows you to view your items in the repository, and to make copies of the items to make depositing updated versions easier.

This will create a new item start editing it and allow you to attach files. You must deposit the item for it to be added to the repository. Deposited items will not appear until they have been checked by a person with that responsibility. You should review your existing items if you can't remember if you have deposited an item or not.

Select this option to change your subscription. This allows you to instruct the repository to automatically email you with lists of documents deposited that match your criteria every day, week or month.
This option allows you to view the current status of the system, including the number of items in each dataset.
This option allows you to view, edit and approve items which users have submitted but have not yet been approved for the repository. You may only edit items within your editorial scope.
This search gives you more power than the public search. It also gives you the option to edit or delete records.
Search the list of users, view ALL their details and edit their records.
Create a new user.
Change the email address which eprints has for you.
This option allows you to create, delete unlink, and link items in the subject tree.
Log in to the repository as a different user. There is currently no "logout" feature.
These are items you are currently in the process of depositing. These will not be considered for the repository until you deposit them.
You currently have no pending items
You have no accepted items

p.strong: You have no items in the repository.

ep:phrase.p: Below are listed your items in the repository. Click on the title of an item to view it.
New Version: This button makes a copy of the item in your workspace. Do this if you are going to submit an updated version of the item. Any attached files will also be copied.

Use as template: If you want to submit a similar item this button will create a new item in your workspacke using the current item as a template. This option will not link the new item to the old one. Any attached files will not be copied.
Request Removal: Request that the administrator removes this item.
Checkout Item: Return this item to your work area. This will mean it temporarily disappears from the repository.

p.em: Please note that we strongly discourage removal of items from the repository. If you upload a new version of an items, a link to the later version will appear on the older version. Thus, anyone finding the old version will be able to see that a newer version has been deposited.

ep:phrase.p: You are requesting the removal of:

ep:phrases.ep:phrase: Couldn't find that item! There's may be a problem with the database. Try again later.
Please enter the reason for removal. The request will be sent to the site administrator.

ep:phrase.p: User (Email: ) requests the removal of the following item:
The following reason was given:
Visit the following URL to view the item and have the option to remove it:
Your request has been sent the the adminstrator.

ep:phrases.ep:phrase: You may not request the removal of this item

ep:phrase.p: To change your email address you should enter the new email below. The system will then mail you a URL to visit to activate this new address.
This system ensures that we always have a valid email address for you.
The email address we currently have for you is:
You did not actually supply a new email address.
An email has been sent to containing the code required to confirm this new email address.
This code is only valid for a short time
A user with the email address already exists.
If this is your email address, you should just reset your password.

ep:phrases.ep:phrase: WARNING: Available space for new items is running low

ep:phrase.p: You may configure subscriptions to this repository. A subscription is a stored search which will be run every day, week or month. Any matching items which have been added or modified since last time will be mailed to you.
Please specify the properties of this subscription.
You currently have no subscriptions.

ep:phrases.ep:phrase: New or changed items matching this search will be mailed to you.
How often do you want to be sent this subscription. A setting of "never" disables this subscription.
If there are no new items matching your subscription, since it was last mailed, do you still want to be mailed?

Yes, mail me empty subscriptions.
No. Only mail me subscriptions with content.

ep:phrase.p: Please select an output format:
Requested output format '' is not available.
Please enter your username and password.
Binding your login to a single IP (Internet address) is more secure, but may be annoying if you use an internet service provider which changes your IP address each time you dial in.
You are already logged in as .
If you wish to log in as a different user you must Logout first.
Enter a username for the new user below.

p.em: A user with the username "" already exists!

ep:phrase.p: There are currently no items matching your editorial scope, which is:
The following items match your editorial scope, which is:
Click on the title of an item to view, edit, accept or reject it.

ep:phrases.ep:phrase: Click here to go to the User Area

ep:phrase.p: This is the EPrints subject editor tool. You should be aware that it can make major changes which cannot be undone. If you remove a subject which is the only subject of an eprint then you will no longer be able to find that eprint via the browse views, only by the search.
Be careful. Think before deleting anything.
(Of course, if this is not a live repository, then it doesn't matter.)

ep:phrases.ep:phrase: The specified subject does not exist, or a database error has occured.

ep:phrase.p: Subject ID:
Enter the ID of an existing child which is NOT an ancestor of the subject, or enter an used subject id to create a new subject.

ep:phrases.ep:phrase: No ID given for new child
New child is an ancestor of this subject (This would cause a loop)
Staff Search of Items in User Workareas
Staff Search of Items in Editorial Review
Staff Search of Items in the Repository

ep:phrase.p: Don't panic! Just leave the fields you don't want to search blank.

ep:phrase.p: Please enter in the box below the reason for bouncing/deleting this item, and any possible fix. This will be emailed to the relevant author.
(The authors language of preference is "".)

ep:phrases.ep:phrase: Cannot find the data for the user who submitted this item.
The item was successfully deleted/bounced, but for some reason the user couldn't be mailed. Username: , email .
The item could not be bounced/deleted - this probably indicates a database error. Check the logs.

ep:phrase.p: Item Successfully Removed
Item Successfully moved back into editorial review.
You may now edit it if you wish.

ep:phrases.ep:phrase: Could not remove user. Check the logs for more information.

ep:phrase.p: The user "" has been deleted.
Any items associated with that user have not been removed. They are still associated with userid #.
This form allows staff to search the records of all registered users.
Don't panic! Just leave the fields you don't want to search blank. Click here for a simple search.
Could not find the file:

The specified file could not be found on this server. If you reached this page by following a link within the repository, please contact the &archivename; administration. Otherwise, please check that you have typed the URL in correctly, or contact the person or site that supplied you with this URL.
ERROR: No reference specified.
You may also wish to try searching for your item using the ParaCite assisted searching service.

ep:phrases.ep:phrase: If you've forgotten your username and/or password, just type your email address into the box below, and your username and password will be mailed to you.

Preferred language set to

Some pages may be cached in your browser. Use your browser "reload" button to get the page in your requested language.

p.ep:pin: Click here to see user's record.

ep:phrase.p: Number of items submitted by this user:

ep:phrases.ep:phrase: The specified ID code is not a valid ID code.
Please enter the ID code of the item you wish to view below. You can enter a standard ID code, an Open Archives full ID code, or just the digits on the right hand side of an ID code.

ep:phrase.p: Registration is not enabled on this system.
In order to access some areas of the repository, you'll need a user registration. No charge is made for registering with us or using any of our services.
This page lets you register with &archivename;. This will allow you to create subscriptions and deposit items.
Your new password will need to confirm your email address by using a code which will be mailed to you.
If you have already registered but have forgotten your username or password, click here to set a new password.
You have not filled in the "" field.
A user with the email address already exists.
Rather than register, you should just reset your password.
Another user already has the username already exists.
You have registered with username .
This registration will not be activated until you visit the confirmation URL which has been emailed to

ep:phrases.ep:phrase: This will set which language is used for automated emails
This must be a valid email address.
A username must begin with a letter and only contain letters and numerals.
A combination of uppercase and lowercase letters and numerals.

ep:phrase.p: To register, use the Registration Form.
If you have registered but have forgotten the password you may set a new password using the Reset Password Form.
This feature is not available on this system.
If you are an existing user but have forgotten your password then you may use this form to set a new one.
You did not specify an email address.
There is no account with email address "".
The user with the email address may not change their password via this mechanism. If this is a problem please contact the site administrator.
You did not actually specify a password.
An email has been sent to containing the code required to confirm this password.
This code is only valid for a short time
Nothing new in the last 7 days.
User not found. It is possible that indicates a database problem, but please check the parameters in the URL carefully.
The confirmation pin is incorrect. Please try and reset your password to generate an email with a new confirmation pin number.
The confirmation pin number has timed out. Please repeat the reset password or registration request, and confirm it as soon as you get the email.
There are currently no changes for this user which await confirmation. This probably means you have already confirmed the change. Try and login.
Your email address has been changed to
Your password has been changed to the new one you requested.

ep:phrase.p: Bad parameters. Do not try and access this script directly.
This feature has been disabled for this repository.
The system is currently unable to send email. Please try again later. If this problem persists, please contact the administrator with details.

ep:phrases.ep:phrase: Please select the most appropriate type for your deposit.
If this item is a revised version of another document in the repository, please enter its ID code in this box.
If your item is a commentary on another item (or author's response to a commentary) in the repository, please enter its ID in this box.
Leaving this field blank will not affect the password. If you change your password you will be logged out.
Set a password. This will not be activated until you enter a security code which will be mailed to you.
The subjects within which this user may "edit" eprints. That is they may review and approve/bounce them etc.
The email address for this user
Your preferred language. Where possible information will be mailed in this language.
The user will only be able to approve and modify items which match the following rules. If there are no restriction conditions the user will be able to edit any item.
How often do you want to be sent a list of all the items in editorial review matching your editorial rights.
If there are items in editorial review, within your editorial rights, should the repository still send you an empty email?

Yes, mail me when editorial review is empty.
No. Only mail me when there is something I can edit and approve.
Please indicate the primary language of this format.
Please select the storage format of this document.
You may offer an additional brief description of the format.
Please indicate the required "security level" of this document. Who is allowed to download it?
Specify an explicit license for this document (does not effect the access rights you grant at the end of this deposit process).
This is the "screen" name of the subject, the one that the users will see.
Can users add items to this subject?

Yes, users can add items to this subject.
No. (In which case it should probably have some children.

This is the internal key for this subject. It is used in the database and to generate the "views" filenames. It shoud contain only a-z, 0-9 and dash "/"and underscore "_". If you enter the ID of an existing subject then that subject will be linked as a child of the current subject.
